Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Sexpo 2005" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(September 2018)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Sexpo 2005** is [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia)'s first sex exhibition held from 18 November to 20 November in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was an exhibition event that showcased different aspects of health, lifestyle, culture and novelty. Among the cultural exhibits were miniature sculptures placed in [dowry](/wiki/Dowry) boxes to teach young couples how to consummate their marriage, an early form of Chinese sex education that dates from the [Qing Dynasty](/wiki/Qing_Dynasty) (1644-1911). The event also included seminars and forums by medical doctors, [sexologist](/wiki/Sexologist) and other experts on [sexual health](/wiki/Sexual_health) problems and solutions. There were also sessions on sensual dancing and novelties, some of which were restricted to people above the age of 21 years. Other topics included [infertility](/wiki/Infertility) and treatments, and advice on how parents can discuss [sex education](/wiki/Sex_education) with their children. More than 43,000 visitors witnessed this inaugural event in Singapore. - Sexpo 2005
title: Sexpo 2005
